entry.title: John Anderson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sir John Anderson (pictured) was described as the "world's most-shot-at-man" in 1935, after surviving three assassination attempts?

entry.title: Russian torture chambers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after the liberation of towns in Ukraine during the Ukrainian Kharkiv counteroffensive, authorities found evidence of numerous Russian torture chambers?

entry.title: Maria Sole Ferrieri Caputi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Maria Sole Ferrieri Caputi is the first woman to referee a Serie A football match?

entry.title: a Connecticut radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Connecticut radio station was "the loser in a survival-of-the-fittest battle"?

entry.title: Abdel Moneim Mokhtar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Abdel Moneim Mokhtar travelled to the 1928 Summer Olympics to compete in gymnastics, but took part in diving instead?

entry.title: 2022 British Open (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shaun Murphy lost a match at the 2022 British Open despite potting the winning ball?

entry.title: Garrett Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the best novel of American science fiction author Garrett Smith did not appear as a stand-alone book until over 60 years after his death?

entry.title: Wish You Were Gay (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Billie Eilish wrote the song "Wish You Were Gay", its subject came out to her as gay?
